intro: Sisymbrium fragile, commonly known as the slender broomrape, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and a taproot system, which allows it to survive in dry conditions. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain areas. Due to its parasitic nature, it lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients.
